Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Nisin O (natural AMPs; lantibiotic, type 1, class 1 bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; UCSS1b)
Sequence Information.Source: Blautia obeumstrain A2-162, human microbiota:gut, faecal microbiome

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (72.73%) tonisin PActivity: active against Gram+ C. perfringens and C. difficile in the presence of trypsin (on a solid medium).Recombinant production:bacteria:Lactococcus lactis: heterologous expression of the novel cluster with the structural peptideson a nisin A inducible system. Est.Jan2024;
Literature Information.Author: Hatziioanou D, Gherghisan-Filip C, Saalbach G, Horn N, Wegmann U, Duncan SH, Flint HJ, Mayer MJ, Narbad A2017
Literature Information.Title: Discovery of a novel lantibiotic nisin O from Blautia obeum A2-162, isolated from the human gastrointestinal tract.
